Class GGButtonAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.aplu.android.GGButtonAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GGSoftButtonListener

    public class GGButtonAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements GGSoftButtonListener
    Declarations of empty methods called when a soft button is touched.

      • buttonReleased

        public void buttonReleased(int buttonNb)
        Event callback when the button is release. Happens also if pressed inside and and released outside the button.
        Specified by:
        buttonReleased in interface GGSoftButtonListener
        Parameters:
        buttonNb - the number of the button (0..3)

      • buttonRepeated

        public void buttonRepeated(int buttonNb)
        Event callback when the button is hold down. The notification is invoked immediately when the button is pressed, then a time of about 0.5 s elapses until the next invocation. Further invocations happens repeatedly with a period of about 0.2 s until the button is released. To avoid concurrency problems, be aware that all invocations are performed by a new separate thread.
        Specified by:
        buttonRepeated in interface GGSoftButtonListener
        Parameters:
        buttonNb - the number of the button (0..3)

      • buttonClicked

        public void buttonClicked(int buttonNb)
        Event callback when the button is clicked (pressed and released).
        Specified by:
        buttonClicked in interface GGSoftButtonListener
        Parameters:
        buttonNb - the number of the button (0..3)
